New Records: Jude Bellingham scored England's first shot on target in a knockout game at a major tournament since the 1986 World Cup quarter-final.
Key Match Events: Ivan Schranz scored the opening goal for Slovakia in the 25th minute.
Phil Foden's goal was ruled offside early in the second half.
Declan Rice hit the post in the 81st minute.
Jude Bellingham scored an overhead kick in the 95th minute to take the game to extra time.
Harry Kane headed home the winning goal in the first minute of extra time.
Post-Match Reflections: Gareth Southgate's tactical decisions were questioned despite the win.
England's performance was criticized for lacking tempo and creativity.
Southgate's job was potentially saved by Jude Bellingham's goal.
England will need to improve significantly against Switzerland in the quarter-final.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The theme from The Great Escape was played during extra time.
England's first half performance was compared to their worst in the tournament so far.
